casebody.data:
STATE EX REL. UTILITIES COMMISSION
v.
ATTORNEY GENERAL 401A18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. November 29, 2018 Jennifer T. Harrod, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, Teresa L. Townsend, Margaret A. Force, Assistant Attorney Generals, James W. Doggett, Deputy Solicitor General, for Stein, Josh (Attorney General). Kiran H. Mehta, Molly McIntosh Jagannathan, Attorneys at Law, Charlotte, Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC. Matthew D. Quinn, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Sierra Club. Peter H. Ledford, Attorney at Law, Benjamin Smith, Regulatory Counsel, for N.C. Sustainable Energy Association. Gudrun Thompson, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Justice Center, et al. David L. Neal, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Justice Center, et al. David T. Drooz, Staff Attorney, Lucy E. Edmondson, Staff Attorney, Raleigh, for N.C. Utilities Commission-Public Staff.

The following order has been entered on the joint motion filed on the 29th of November 2018 to Consolidate Appeals and to Enter Briefing Schedule:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 29th of November 2018."
